Welcome to SuperSimpleStocks’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class simpleStocks.stock(sym, typ, ldiv, pval, fdiv=None)¶

Simple stock class to contain static data pertaining to a stock, contins fuctions which utilize external variable price to calculate metrics

PE_ratio(price)¶

Returns the price earnings ratio of a stock given a price defined as price/Last Dividend

buy(price, qty, buysell='B')¶

returns a ‘buy’ trade object on a stock instance

dividend_yield(price)¶

Bound method, takes float argument. calculates dividend yield according to Dividend Yield = Last Dividend / price - if common stock Dividend Yield = (Fixed Dividend * Par Value) / price - if preferred stock

sell(price, qty, buysell='S')¶

returns a ‘sell’ trade object on a stock instance

class simpleStocks.trade(stock, price, qty, buysell, timestamp=None)¶

simple trade class, an instance will represent a trade on a given sock includes a time, quantity, price, buysell indicator

PE_ratio()¶

calculates P/E ratio as given by stock uses instance of the trade price

dividend_yield()¶

calculates dividend yield as given by stock uses instance of the trade price

status()¶

string to show if trade has been ‘Bought’ ‘B’ or ‘Sold’ ‘S’

class simpleStocksImplementation.GBCE_exchange(static_stock_data, trades=None)¶

GBCE_exchange is a class which emulates an active exchange it takes an argument of an array of stocks (static reference data) and simulates trades on those stocks. Class also contains group metrics (such as vwap and index calculation) and some sorting/subset selection on the trades

GBCE_index()¶

Method to compute and return the GBCE_index. Defined as the arithmetic mean of the vwap() of each traded sym

generate_trades(n)¶

Mehtod to ‘publish’ n more trades to the GBCE_exchange instace

get_trades_asof(time, trades=None)¶

Method to return trades asof a given time

get_trades_by_sym(sym, trades=None)¶

Method to return trades on a specific sym

sort_trades(attr, reverse=True)¶

Method to sort trades by a particular attribute of the underlying class

vwap(sym)¶

Method to calculate and return the Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) utilizes get_trades_by_sym and get_trades_asof Methods takes sym as argument and returns vwap for sym ( for trades as of 5 mins ago )
